Description: Sets the name of the server. Maximum 40 characters
Sets the description of the server. Maximum 200 characters
DefaultValue: Welcome to my Rimworld Together server!
Placeholder: Welcome to my Rimworld Together server!

Description: If enabled, the server will be visible in the public server browser
Sets the public endpoint address (IP or domain) for the server, as used by the server browser
Sets the maximum number of players that may connect to the server at one time
If set, allows only the usernames listed under Whitelisted Players to join the server
Sets a list of in-game usernames for whitelisted players. Requires Enable Whitelist to be set
If set, the server console will include additional logging output for developer or debugging purposes. Not recommended for normal use
If set, the server console will include much more verbose logging
If set, player chat will be displayed in the server console
If set, UPnP will be used to automatically configure port forwarding on compatible routers
If set, local save syncing will be enabled
If set, temporal activity protection will be enabled
Sets the cooldown between receiving activity requests. Temporal Activity Protection must be enabled
If set, temporal event protection will be enabled
Sets the cooldown between receiving player-sent events. Temporal Event Protection must be enabled
If set, temporal aid protection will be enabled
Sets the cooldown between receiving player-sent aid. Temporal Aid Protection must be enabled
If set, temporal spy protection will be enabled
Sets the cooldown between spying attempts. Temporal Spy Protection must be enabled
If enabled, the server will automatically create backups at regular intervals
Sets the interval between automatic backups. A backup is also created when the server is started
If enabled, old backups will be automatically deleted, based on Backup Retention Amount
Sets the number of backups to keep before older backups are deleted, if Automatic Backup Deletion is enabled
If set, offline visting and raiding will be enabled
If set, events will be enabled
If set, creation of sites will be enabled
If set, creation of user-built roads will be enabled
If set, creation of user-made factions will be enabled
If set, transfer of pawns will be enabled
If set, transfer of items will be enabled
If set, spying on offline will be enabled
If set, selection by users of custom scenarios will be allowed
If set, permanent destruction of NPC settlements by users will be allowed
If set, users with Biotech will be allowed to spread pollution to world tiles, including other players
Sets the game speed the server will be running at. 0 = no restriction
Sets the cost of spying on a player
If enabled, all players will be forced to use the following difficulty settings
Adjusts the size of threats like raids and infestations, and the difficulty of quests
If set, allows major threats such as raids, infestations, manhunter packs, crashed mechanoid ships and more
If set, allows quests to present with violent threats and challenges. Otherwise quests will be non-violent
If set, enables the fixed intro threats that appear near game start
If set, allows wild predators to hunt humans
If set, allows extreme weather incidents, such as toxic fallout, volcanic winters and flashstorms
Adjusts the amount of materials produced when harvesting plants and crops, including cutting trees
Adjusts the amount of materials produced when mining
Adjusts the amount of materials produced when butchering, including meat, leather, and yield from shredding mechanoids
Adjusts the speed of research
Adjusts the value of rewards given for quests. Note that the quest reward value is also automatically scaled to compensate for the threat scale, and so this setting adds an additional multiplier
Adjusts the value of loot carried by raiders. Note that the raid loot value is also automatically scaled to compensate for the threat scale, and so this setting adds an additional multiplier
When trading, buy prices are increased by this amount while sell prices are reduced by this amount. Maximum 0.5
Adjusts the cost of rearming turrets. Minimum 0.01
Sets the probability that a corpse will rot upon death, if the creature has the scaria disease
Adjusts the extra chance that an enemy will immediately die when downed. This affects the chances to take prisoners, and thus colony population growth rates
Sets a permanent mood offset applied to every colonist and prisoner. Colonists have a base mood of 50%
Adjusts the chance that a person will get food poisoning from eating a potentially-poisoned meal
Adjusts the chance that injuring a wild animal will cause it to attack
Adjusts the chance that a wound will become infected
Adjust the frequency of random disease events
Adjust the time it takes for hives to reproduce
Adjust the chance of triggering an infestation when deep drilling
Adjusts the chance of friendly fire. Only affects direct shots that were going to hit their target
Adjusts the chance that a colonist can die instantly due to an attack, with the colonist being downed instead. Only prevents some kinds of instant kills
If set, temples will be peaceful
If set, cave hives will be allowed
If set, prisoners will be unwavering
If set, players can build traps like spike traps and IED traps
If set, players can build static turrets like mini-turrets, autocannon turrets, and uranium slug turrets
If set, players can build mortars
If set to true, classic mortars will be used
Adjusts how much the adaptation score affects difficulty
Adjusts how fast the adaptation score grows over time
If set, the server will operate in a wealth-independent progress mode, replacing the wealth factor with a fixed progress curve based on time

With a single colonist of the player's starting ideoligion, the conversion chance to their ideoligion is multiplied by this amount. Conversion attempts against them have their impact divided by this amount
If set, humans can't become pregnant. Human babies and children will never appear unless chosen as starting colonists
If set, human babies are always born healthy. Mothers can't die in childbirth or have miscarriages
If set, hostile raids will sometimes include children
Adjusts the rate at which babies and children will age
Adjusts the rate at which adults will age
Adjusts the chance that a dissolved wastepack will trigger the arrival of insect cocoons
If set, user-built dirt paths will be allowed.
If set, user-built dirt roads will be allowed.
If set, user-built stone roads will be allowed.
If set, user-built asphalt paths will be allowed.
If set, user-built asphalt highways will be allowed.
Sets the cost of building a dirt path
Sets the cost of building a dirt road
Sets the cost of building a stone road
Sets the cost of building an asphalt path
Sets the cost of building an asphalt highway
Sets the [server release version](https://github.com/RimworldTogether/Rimworld-Together/releases) to install. Empty = latest. Update the server after changing this setting
Sets the [ASP.NET Core 7.0 version](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/download/dotnet/7.0) to install. Update the server after changing this setting
